company: US Other Agencies and Independent Organizations
job_text: ['Marketing and Communications: Works with the Office Director to develop a comprehensive marketing and communications strategy for 3GL across a range of channels, inducing social media, email marketing, web and events (in-person and virtual). Responsible for planning, designing and executing marketing and communications program per leadership guidance and in conjunction with agency partners to inform and educate general and specialized audiences, both external and internal, about 3GL program opportunities, activities and services.', 'Analysis and Reporting: Develops recommendations for evaluating the marketing and communications strategy. Conducts research and data analysis to assist the 3GL Director in developing clear goals and corresponding Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to evaluate the success of the tactics associated with the 3GL goals and strategy. Assists in developing and establishing benchmarks by conducting research on industry trends and providing market research on associated tools/ platforms. Develops reports, analysis, data visualizations and dashboards for monitoring progress toward established goals. Includes ongoing reporting and ad-hoc reports on special topics or issues. Includes the development of a plan for social listening for topics and individuals relevant to the mission of 3GL.', 'Audience Analysis: Proposes and supports the execution of a plan to improve understanding of 3GL audiences. Audiences include, but are not limited to: Returned Peace Corps Volunteers (RPCVs), Peace Corps Volunteers (PCVs), RPCV support groups, educators, employers and the American public. RPCVs, in particular, are a heterogeneous group and will require detailed segmentation and analysis.', 'System Requirements: Takes a user-centric and data informed approach to the development of requirements and user stories for Peace Corps-managed systems that support the 3GL marketing and communications strategy. Includes the RPCV Portal, LearningSpace (the agency’s Learning Management System), the Peace Corps website (peacecorps.gov) and the agency’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform.', 'Customer Support: Provides support to other team members, as required, to support office customer services goals and objectives.', 'Job family (Series)0301 Miscellaneous Administration And Program', 'RequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentPlease refer to "Conditions of Employment"Intelligence Background InformationPeace Corps Manual Section 611 is applicable to this position. This section prohibits the employment of certain persons previously engaged in intelligence activities or connected with intelligence agencies within the past 10 years. If you have ever worked for the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), you are not eligible for employment at the Peace Corps in any capacity, and you should not apply for employment.PC-1336 Form: Applicants who are found to be otherwise qualified will be required to submit upon request in the future a completed PC-1336 form, or narrative signed statement, indicating whether the applicant has been involved in or has had any connection with intelligence activities or related work and, if so, the nature and dates of his or her involvement. Failure to meet this requirement will result in the applicant being rated ineligible for further consideration. If you have any other type of possible intelligence connection, your application will not be further considered until you submit this form. Except when the CIA or the National Security Agency (NSA) is involved (see below), if your connection with an Intelligence Agency involves an immediate family member who works or has worked in intelligence, the immediate family member should complete the form, not the applicant. Usually relying on memory is sufficient to answer most if not all of the questions. If you have an immediate family member who works or has worked for the CIA, you should not give them this form to complete. Please contact your relative in person—not by phone, email, social networking, or any other means that is not in person— and ask him or her to contact the Office of General Counsel at the CIA.If your intelligence connection involves the NSA, you (or, if the connection is with a family member, that person) must contact NSA’s Office of the General Counsel at 410-854-3910 before submitting this form to Peace Corps.QualificationsSpecialized Experience:You must meet the specialized experience at the grade level(s) in which you choose to be considered by 11:59 p.m. Eastern Standard Time (EST) on the closing date of the announcement. To ensure full credit for your experience, please indicate dates of employment by month, day, and year and the number of hours worked per week in your resume.This vacancy is being announced at 2 (two) grade levels:FP-5 (GS-9 Equivalent)Qualifying experience for the FP-5 level includes one year of specialized experience at least equivalent to the FP-7 or GS-7 level which is in or directly related to the line of work of the position to be filled and which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position. Specialized experience includes: Experience planning, designing, and executing marketing communication programs; Experience leading an approved marketing and communications strategy; Experience developing reports, analysis, data visualizations and dashboards for monitoring progress toward established goals.ormaster\'s or equivalent graduate degreeor2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degreeorLL.B. or J.D., if relatedFP-4 (GS-11/12 Equivalent)Qualifying experience for the FP-4 level includes one year of specialized experience at least equivalent to the FP-5 or GS-9 level which is in or directly related to the line of work of the position to be filled and which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position. ['Plays a key role in assisting and supporting strategic planning, performance measurement, metric development, risk management, coordinating, and reviewing management programs and operations within Enterprise Risk and Planning Staff (ERPS).', 'Supplies and assess performance data and information.', 'Assists with, leads and coordinates FSIS evidence in evaluation activities in compliance with the Foundations for Evidence-based Policymaking Act.', 'Assists with program analyses, evaluation studies, data analyses, data visualization, and developing and using dashboards for a broad range of FSIS programs to assess program performance, coordinates data collection activities, etc.', 'Participates in the collection of information to perform program risk assessments.', 'Job family (Series)1501 General Mathematics And Statistics', 'RequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentSatisfactory background investigation and/or fingerprint check required.U.S. Citizenship is required.May be subject to satisfactory completion of one year probationary or trial period.If you are selected, you may need to complete a Declaration for Federal Employment (OF-306) prior to being appointed to determine suitability for Federal employment and to authorize a background investigation.False statements or responses on a resume or application can jeopardize employment and may be grounds for disciplinary action, including removal from Federal service.Have your salary sent to a financial institution of your choice by Direct Deposit/Electronic Funds Transfer.If you are newly hired, the documentation you present for purposes of completing the Department Homeland Security (DHS) Form I-9 on your entry-on-duty date will be verified through the DHS "E-VERIFY" system.Federal law requires the use of E-VERIFY to confirm the employment eligibility of all new hires. Under this system, the new hire is required to resolve any identified discrepancies as a condition of continued employment.Selectee must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance. Failure to successfully meet these requirements could lead to adverse action proceedings including possible termination.Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.QualificationsApplicants must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of the announcement including time-in-grade restrictions, specialized experience and/or education, as defined below.To qualify for the GS-09 level: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-07 level in the Federal service that demonstrates the following:Develops, prepares, and updates comprehensive reports, charts, graphics, and presentations to illustrate findings.Contributes to improving the accountability and effectiveness of highly visible programs and/or projects.OREducation: You must possess a master\'s or equivalent graduate degree or 2 years of progressively higher-level graduate education leading to a master\'s degree. This education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of this position. One year of full-time graduate education is considered to be the number of credit hours that the school attended has determined to represent 1 year of full-time study. If that information cannot be determined from the school, 18 semester hours should be considered as equivalent to 1 year of full-time study. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)ORCombination: You must have an appropriate combination of successfully completed graduate level education and experience. To determine your combination, first compute your experience as a percentage of the experience listed above; then determine your education as a percentage of the education listed above; then add the two percentages. The total percentages must equal at least 100 percent. Only graduate education in excess of 1 year (18 semester hours) may be used to qualify. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)To qualify for the GS-11 level: Must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-09 level in the Federal service. In addition to the above requirement for the GS-09 specialized experience for the GS-11 must include all of the following:Provide key support role in strategic planning, performance measurement, metric development, enterprise risk management.Coordinating, and reviewing management programs and/or operations.Prepares analyses, unique reports, or ad hoc reports on an "as required" basis.OREducation: You must possess a Ph.D. or equivalent doctoral degree or 3 years of progressively higher-level graduate education leading to a Ph.D. degree. This education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of this position. One year of full-time graduate education is considered to be the number of credit hours that the school attended has determined to represent 1 year of full-time study. If that information cannot be determined from the school, 18 semester hours should be considered as equivalent to 1 year of full-time study. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)ORCombination: You must have an appropriate combination of successfully completed graduate level education and experience. To determine your combination, first compute your experience as a percentage of the experience listed above; then determine your education as a percentage of the education listed above; then add the two percentages. The total percentages must equal at least 100 percent. Only graduate education in excess of 2 years (36 semester hours) may be used to qualify. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)To qualify for the GS-12 level: Must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-11 level in the Federal service. In addition to the above requirement for the GS-09 and GS-11 specialized experience for the GS-12 must include the following:Develops efforts incorporating analysis of data from relevant sources to increase value.Assesses and ensures consistency of data reporting and analysis.Prepares and contributes to analyses or studies to include background research, information gathering and report writing.Education cannot be substituted for experience to qualify for the GS-12 grade level.For more information on the qualifications for these positions, click here:https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=Group-StandardsExperience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.IN DESCRIBING YOUR EXPERIENCE, PLEASE BE CLEAR AND SPECIFIC. WE MAY NOT MAKE ASSUMPTIONS REGARDING YOUR EXPERIENCE.EducationBasic Requirement:A. Degree: Mathematics, statistics, or actuarial science. The degree must be in a major field of study (at least at the baccalaureatelevel) that is appropriate for the position. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)ORB. Combination of education and experience: Courses equivalent to a major field of study as shown in paragraph A above, plusadditional education or appropriate experience. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)In addition to meeting the Basic Requirement above, applicants must also meet the appropriate Minimum Qualifications requirement below for the grade level(s) in which they are applying.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: To be considered minimally qualified for this position, you must demonstrate that you have the required specialized experience and/or education for the respective grade level in which you are applying:Foreign Education: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show that the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university.For further information, visit: https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.htmlAdditional informationCareer Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP), Reemployed Priority List (RPL), or Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP): To exercise selection priority for this vacancy, CTAP/RPL/ICTAP candidates must meet the basic eligibility requirements and all selective factors. CTAP/ICTAP candidates must be rated and determined to be well qualified (or above) based on an evaluation of the competencies listed in the How You Will Be Evaluated section. When assessed through a score-based category rating method, CTAP/ICTAP applications must receive a rating of at least 85 out of a possible 100.This announcement may be used to fill multiple vacancies.Persons with disabilities who require alternative means for communication of program information (Braille, large print, audiotape, etc.) should contact: USDAs TARGET Center at 202-720-2600 (voice and TDD).This position is eligible for telework and other flexible work arrangements. (Include initial hire actions, extensions, conversions, and separation SF-50s for each period of work). b. Documentation of Acceptable Performance for Service Time:1. If documentation of rating does not exist for one or more periods, a statement from the employee's supervisor(s) or other individual in the chain of command indicating an acceptable level of performance for the period(s) of employment counted towards their eligibility; or 3. Applicants who do not provide a performance appraisal or other performance documentation for any period that they are using for eligibility under the LMWFA, shall provide:a. A stated reason as to why the appraisal/documentation is not available; and b. A statement that their performance for all periods was at an acceptable level, their most recent separation was for reasons other than misconduct or performance, and they were never notified that they were not eligible for rehire based on performance. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit https://www.e-verify.gov/.QualificationsApplicants must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of the announcement including time-in-grade restrictions, specialized experience and/or education, as defined below.TIME-IN-GRADE: Current federal employees applying for a promotion opportunity must meet time-in-grade (TIG) requirement of 52 weeks of service at the next lower grade level in the normal line of progression for the position being filled.FOR THE GS-11 LEVEL: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience (equivalent to the GS-09 grade level) that demonstrates:Experience entering data and generating reports from case management and workflow systems, assigning and tracking work for other staff and managers, and generating performance measures and analyzing reports from different databases and systems.Experience troubleshooting, teaching, and assisting end users in how to use a specialized software system or case management system, including one-on-one support and training/tutorial development.Experience reviewing incoming technical correspondence, determining appropriate handling, preparing responses based on existing procedures, and reviewing technical documents for compliance, completeness, and sufficiency when compared to agency policies and procedures.Experience writing executive summaries or briefings, procedures and checklists, email and formal letter correspondence, and/or tracking reports and summaries.Experience developing and implementing project plans that include multiple tasks, steps, deliverables, and dependencies.Experience designing new queries and reports from existing databases or case management systems.OR Successful completion of a Ph.D./equivalent doctoral degree or at least three full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree in Business, Public Policy/Administration, Statistics/Data Analysis, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Environmental Science, Agriculture, or similar field.OR Successful completion of an LL.M.Equivalent combinations of education and experience are qualifying for this grade level.TRANSCRIPTS are required if:You are qualifying for the position based on education.You are qualifying for this position based on a combination of experience and education.This education must have been successfully completed and obtained from an accredited school, college, or universityCOMBINATION OF EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE AT THE GS-11 GRADE LEVEL: Applicants may have combinations of successfully completed education and specialized experience to meet total qualification requirements. Volunteer work helps build critical competencies and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.EducationThis position does not have an education qualification requirement.Additional informationCareer Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP), Reemployment Priority List (RPL), or Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP): Visit the OPM website for information on how to apply as a CTAP, RPL, or ICTAP eligible. ['Design and create a variety of integral reports utilizing dashboards and other visualization tools.', 'Develop and maintain automated reports and dashboards using SQL Server, and/or SSRS/SSIS/SSAS.', 'Manage data loads, security, and integrity of a data mart.', 'Analyze and model structured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analysis.', 'Collaborate with multiple teams and clients to understand and recommend analytic solutions.', 'Interpret and analyze data collected from a variety of sources using exploratory and statistical techniques, validating findings using an experimental and iterative approaches.', "Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related discipline.", 'At least 5 years of experience in business intelligence and analytics.', 'Proficiency querying data sources, including Azure, Amazon S3, Amazon RedShift, and RDS.', 'Experience and understanding of Agile software development lifecycle.', 'Exceptional written/oral communication skills.', 'Experience working with the U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs or other government agencies.', 'Ability to obtain a Government clearance.', 'Medical/Dental/Vision', '401k with 3% matching', 'Corporate Laptop', 'PTO + Federal Holidays', 'Training opportunities']

['Actively collaborate across many teams', 'Analyze and synthesize legislation and policy at the federal, state, and local levels for clients', 'Deliver written analysis and professional communication to clients ranging from Analyst to Executive levels', 'Use and analyze data to understand, interpret, visualize quantitative research and insights', 'Manage and execute on multiple projects simultaneously with high attention to detail, while meeting tight deadlines', 'Help to create and scope tailored solutions to pair with the FiscalNote product suite', 'Join client calls and meetings to support the sales of professional services products', 'Own the functional aspects of client projects including project management, documentation of requirements and timeline, communication of status and more', 'Become an expert in our current products and solutions while contributing to the development of new technical and professional services products.', 'Communicate client and product-related feedback to product, engineering and sales teams', '1-2 years of relevant professional experience in research, government, and/or consulting', 'A proven track record of managing multiple projects simultaneously', 'Strong written and verbal communication skills and exceptional organization and time-management skills', 'A strong interest in the intersection of politics, policy, and technology', "A Bachelor's degree in political science, government, economics or a related subject or equivalent experience", 'Policy experience to analyze laws at multiple levels of government on behalf of clients', 'Experience analyzing data and conveying concise targeted insights', 'Strong independent research skills and the ability to learn new things quickly', 'Ability to use data visualization tools to produce dashboards and other interactive visualizations for client organizations (Preferred)', 'Working fluency in another language (Preferred)']

['You can learn new skills and tools quickly and thrive in a fast-paced environment', 'You have an astute attention to detail and take great pride in your work product', 'You are responsible, organized, and understand the importance of documentation', 'You’re creative and innovative - not afraid to take a risk to follow a hunch', 'You understand both the potential and the limitations of data and are able to explain complicated concepts to non-technical audiences', 'You’re at home in a spreadsheet and are able to present data in a way that’s clear, compelling, and actionable', 'You have experience writing and editing SQL queries (we use Redshift and BigQuery)', 'You have strong time management and project management skills, with the ability to handle a variety of workstreams, deadlines, stakeholders, and teammates', 'You’re interested in sharing your knowledge with teammates and learning from them', 'You’ve held at least one role working with voter file data', 'You have heavy experience with voter file data, census data, and/or related models', 'You have more advanced SQL skills, including understanding of query optimization in Amazon Redshift and/or Google BigQuery', 'You’ve built reports and dashboards in Excel, Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Tableau, Periscope, or similar and have many thoughts about data visualization', 'You can program in Python or R and are familiar with common libraries and packages', 'You’re comfortable automating with APIs, AWS, Google Cloud, or Civis Platform', 'You can wrangle a large data set (input, clean, transform, output) quickly and cleanly', 'You have experiencing training staff on data-related and technical tools', 'You are familiar with statistical concepts and application within political field experiments (ITT, TOT, MDE); you have experience designing, running, or analyzing experiments', 'Serve as lead voter file analyst for our Voter Registration and Mobilization programs - process incoming voter files and early vote lists, update audiences, analyze program data, and work with Campaigns and Paid Media teams to optimize our campaigns', 'Design universes in SQL, work with practitioners to facilitate folks pulling their own lists, and develop systems to track universes across campaigns, teams, and platforms', 'Serve as a thought leader—both internally and externally—on the most appropriate uses and applications of our data and how we can better optimize our programs', 'Strategize with Campaign Directors on every piece of our campaigns: who we should be targeting, how we determine that, who we’re missing, and how we’ll evaluate results and appropriately measure impact', 'Post-Election, analyze the success of our programs and make recommendations for future work']

['Plays a key role in assisting and supporting strategic planning, performance measurement, metric development, risk management, coordinating, and reviewing management programs and operations within Enterprise Risk and Planning Staff (ERPS).', 'Supplies and assess performance data and information.', 'Assists with, leads and coordinates FSIS evidence in evaluation activities in compliance with the Foundations for Evidence-based Policymaking Act.', 'Assists with program analyses, evaluation studies, data analyses, data visualization, and developing and using dashboards for a broad range of FSIS programs to assess program performance, coordinates data collection activities, etc.', 'Participates in the collection of information to perform program risk assessments.', 'Job family (Series)1501 General Mathematics And Statistics', 'RequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentSatisfactory background investigation and/or fingerprint check required.U.S. Citizenship is required.May be subject to satisfactory completion of one year probationary or trial period.If you are selected, you may need to complete a Declaration for Federal Employment (OF-306) prior to being appointed to determine suitability for Federal employment and to authorize a background investigation.False statements or responses on a resume or application can jeopardize employment and may be grounds for disciplinary action, including removal from Federal service.Have your salary sent to a financial institution of your choice by Direct Deposit/Electronic Funds Transfer.If you are newly hired, the documentation you present for purposes of completing the Department Homeland Security (DHS) Form I-9 on your entry-on-duty date will be verified through the DHS "E-VERIFY" system.Federal law requires the use of E-VERIFY to confirm the employment eligibility of all new hires. Under this system, the new hire is required to resolve any identified discrepancies as a condition of continued employment.Selectee must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance. Failure to successfully meet these requirements could lead to adverse action proceedings including possible termination.Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.QualificationsApplicants must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of the announcement including time-in-grade restrictions, specialized experience and/or education, as defined below.To qualify for the GS-09 level: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-07 level in the Federal service that demonstrates the following:Develops, prepares, and updates comprehensive reports, charts, graphics, and presentations to illustrate findings.Contributes to improving the accountability and effectiveness of highly visible programs and/or projects.OREducation: You must possess a master\'s or equivalent graduate degree or 2 years of progressively higher-level graduate education leading to a master\'s degree. This education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of this position. One year of full-time graduate education is considered to be the number of credit hours that the school attended has determined to represent 1 year of full-time study. If that information cannot be determined from the school, 18 semester hours should be considered as equivalent to 1 year of full-time study. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)ORCombination: You must have an appropriate combination of successfully completed graduate level education and experience. To determine your combination, first compute your experience as a percentage of the experience listed above; then determine your education as a percentage of the education listed above; then add the two percentages. The total percentages must equal at least 100 percent. Only graduate education in excess of 1 year (18 semester hours) may be used to qualify. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)To qualify for the GS-11 level: Must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-09 level in the Federal service. In addition to the above requirement for the GS-09 specialized experience for the GS-11 must include all of the following:Provide key support role in strategic planning, performance measurement, metric development, enterprise risk management.Coordinating, and reviewing management programs and/or operations.Prepares analyses, unique reports, or ad hoc reports on an "as required" basis.OREducation: You must possess a Ph.D. or equivalent doctoral degree or 3 years of progressively higher-level graduate education leading to a Ph.D. degree. This education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of this position. One year of full-time graduate education is considered to be the number of credit hours that the school attended has determined to represent 1 year of full-time study. If that information cannot be determined from the school, 18 semester hours should be considered as equivalent to 1 year of full-time study. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)ORCombination: You must have an appropriate combination of successfully completed graduate level education and experience. To determine your combination, first compute your experience as a percentage of the experience listed above; then determine your education as a percentage of the education listed above; then add the two percentages. The total percentages must equal at least 100 percent. Only graduate education in excess of 2 years (36 semester hours) may be used to qualify. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)To qualify for the GS-12 level: Must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-11 level in the Federal service. In addition to the above requirement for the GS-09 and GS-11 specialized experience for the GS-12 must include the following:Develops efforts incorporating analysis of data from relevant sources to increase value.Assesses and ensures consistency of data reporting and analysis.Prepares and contributes to analyses or studies to include background research, information gathering and report writing.Education cannot be substituted for experience to qualify for the GS-12 grade level.For more information on the qualifications for these positions, click here:https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=Group-StandardsExperience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.IN DESCRIBING YOUR EXPERIENCE, PLEASE BE CLEAR AND SPECIFIC. WE MAY NOT MAKE ASSUMPTIONS REGARDING YOUR EXPERIENCE.EducationBasic Requirement:A. Degree: Mathematics, statistics, or actuarial science. The degree must be in a major field of study (at least at the baccalaureatelevel) that is appropriate for the position. (You must submit a copy of your transcripts for verification.)ORB. Combination of education and experience: Courses equivalent to a major field of study as shown in paragraph A above, plusadditional education or appropriate experience. ['Design and create a variety of integral reports utilizing dashboards and other visualization tools.', 'Develop and maintain automated reports and dashboards using SQL Server, and/or SSRS/SSIS/SSAS.', 'Manage data loads, security, and integrity of a data mart.', 'Analyze and model structured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analysis.', 'Collaborate with multiple teams and clients to understand and recommend analytic solutions.', 'Interpret and analyze data collected from a variety of sources using exploratory and statistical techniques, validating findings using an experimental and iterative approaches.', "Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related discipline.", 'At least 5 years of experience in business intelligence and analytics.', 'Proficiency querying data sources, including Azure, Amazon S3, Amazon RedShift, and RDS.', 'Experience and understanding of Agile software development lifecycle.', 'Exceptional written/oral communication skills.', 'Experience working with the U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs or other government agencies.', 'Ability to obtain a Government clearance.', 'Medical/Dental/Vision', '401k with 3% matching', 'Corporate Laptop', 'PTO + Federal Holidays', 'Training opportunities']

['Actively collaborate across many teams', 'Analyze and synthesize legislation and policy at the federal, state, and local levels for clients', 'Deliver written analysis and professional communication to clients ranging from Analyst to Executive levels', 'Use and analyze data to understand, interpret, visualize quantitative research and insights', 'Manage and execute on multiple projects simultaneously with high attention to detail, while meeting tight deadlines', 'Help to create and scope tailored solutions to pair with the FiscalNote product suite', 'Join client calls and meetings to support the sales of professional services products', 'Own the functional aspects of client projects including project management, documentation of requirements and timeline, communication of status and more', 'Become an expert in our current products and solutions while contributing to the development of new technical and professional services products.', 'Communicate client and product-related feedback to product, engineering and sales teams', '1-2 years of relevant professional experience in research, government, and/or consulting', 'A proven track record of managing multiple projects simultaneously', 'Strong written and verbal communication skills and exceptional organization and time-management skills', 'A strong interest in the intersection of politics, policy, and technology', "A Bachelor's degree in political science, government, economics or a related subject or equivalent experience", 'Policy experience to analyze laws at multiple levels of government on behalf of clients', 'Experience analyzing data and conveying concise targeted insights', 'Strong independent research skills and the ability to learn new things quickly', 'Ability to use data visualization tools to produce dashboards and other interactive visualizations for client organizations (Preferred)', 'Working fluency in another language (Preferred)']

['You can learn new skills and tools quickly and thrive in a fast-paced environment', 'You have an astute attention to detail and take great pride in your work product', 'You are responsible, organized, and understand the importance of documentation', 'You’re creative and innovative - not afraid to take a risk to follow a hunch', 'You understand both the potential and the limitations of data and are able to explain complicated concepts to non-technical audiences', 'You’re at home in a spreadsheet and are able to present data in a way that’s clear, compelling, and actionable', 'You have experience writing and editing SQL queries (we use Redshift and BigQuery)', 'You have strong time management and project management skills, with the ability to handle a variety of workstreams, deadlines, stakeholders, and teammates', 'You’re interested in sharing your knowledge with teammates and learning from them', 'You’ve held at least one role working with voter file data', 'You have heavy experience with voter file data, census data, and/or related models', 'You have more advanced SQL skills, including understanding of query optimization in Amazon Redshift and/or Google BigQuery', 'You’ve built reports and dashboards in Excel, Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Tableau, Periscope, or similar and have many thoughts about data visualization', 'You can program in Python or R and are familiar with common libraries and packages', 'You’re comfortable automating with APIs, AWS, Google Cloud, or Civis Platform', 'You can wrangle a large data set (input, clean, transform, output) quickly and cleanly', 'You have experiencing training staff on data-related and technical tools', 'You are familiar with statistical concepts and application within political field experiments (ITT, TOT, MDE); you have experience designing, running, or analyzing experiments', 'Serve as lead voter file analyst for our Voter Registration and Mobilization programs - process incoming voter files and early vote lists, update audiences, analyze program data, and work with Campaigns and Paid Media teams to optimize our campaigns', 'Design universes in SQL, work with practitioners to facilitate folks pulling their own lists, and develop systems to track universes across campaigns, teams, and platforms', 'Serve as a thought leader—both internally and externally—on the most appropriate uses and applications of our data and how we can better optimize our programs', 'Strategize with Campaign Directors on every piece of our campaigns: who we should be targeting, how we determine that, who we’re missing, and how we’ll evaluate results and appropriately measure impact', 'Post-Election, analyze the success of our programs and make recommendations for future work']

job_text: ['Someone who has exceptional problem-solving and root cause analysis skills', 'Someone that has 4+ year of Salesforce experience as an advanced user or administrator', 'Someone that is a certified Salesforce Administrator or has the aptitude to be certified within 6 months (paid for by Fonteva)', 'Someone who thrives in high growth and fast-paced environment and sees team success as personal success', 'Provide support to customers Salesforce admins, implementers, program specialists, accountants, and other stakeholders', 'Contribute to and moderate the communities for customers and partners to collaborate on best practices', 'Partner with teams across the company to deliver a great customer experience and solutions', 'Types of requests that will be managed: product and Salesforce questions, best practices guidance, upgrade assistance, configuration issues, data issues, bugs, and feature request', 'Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and ability to communicate technically complex concepts to non-technical audiences', 'Ability to understand customer requests or use cases and translate them into product configurations and requirements', 'Ability to document customer requests and problems over the phone, provide initial diagnosis, and take ownership of the end-to-end resolution', 'Experience or aptitude to learn Salesforce administrative tasks, such as creating users, profiles, roles, page layouts, workflows, approvals, reports, analytic snapshots and dashboards, and email services a plus']

['Job', 'Company', 'BA/BS degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science or Mathematics Undergraduate degree in statistics, business, finance, engineering, or a related field.', 'Proficient in SQL', 'Advanced knowledge of Excel', 'Experience with building dashboard such as Quicksight or Tableau', 'Experience building and managing reporting tools to support business decisions.', 'Experience with spreadsheet modeling and database development', 'Knowledge of current HR systems including MyTime, ADAPT, PeopleInsight, Salesforce', 'Support HR field and regional leadership with deep dive data to help drive business decisions through data analysis of HR metrics.', 'Develop, update, validate, evaluate, and automate reports with the latest internal information to ensure accurate reporting. Including conducting audits.', 'Develop ad-hoc excel reports and dashboards within Quicksight, Tableau, and/or other BI platforms to improve access to and the usability of business performance information.', 'Support the Sr. HR leaders with labor planning assumptions on attendance, attrition and additional AMZL specific HR metrics.', 'Draft business review narratives and additional deep dive findings as needed.', 'Have the ability to be self-sufficient in mining data from various HR systems of record including from Quicksight, Tableaus, My Time, Connections, ADAPT and basic SQL', 'Advanced analytical skills and an ability to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment; work ethic based on a strong desire to exceed expectations; strong interpersonal skills including written and oral communication', 'Creative, critical thinker with advanced business analytical skills', 'Customer focus and professional demeanor', 'Impeccable attention to detail, passion for processes and systems', 'Ability to work with technical and non-technical business owners to deliver result', 'Experience partnering with database engineers to develop data warehouses', 'Strong organizational and multitasking skills with ability to balance competing priorities', 'MBA or advanced degree in economics, statistics, operations research, mathematics or other quantitative disciplines.', 'Advance skills in utilizing macros, SQL, and VBA to extract and aggregate data into meaningful artifacts to support decision making processes and support early identification of risks.', 'High levels of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information.']

job_title: Director of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
job_text: ['Work with Co-CEOs in managing and implementing Gensler’s “Strategies To Fight Racism.”', 'Provide Program Management oversight of broad initiatives and activities across the firm which are focused on growing the diverse communities within Gensler with particular focus on the Black community.', 'Work with the Global Race and Diversity Committee Co-Chairs to create alignment, track progress and effectiveness of the efforts.', 'Work with the RMPs and Regional diversity teams to coordinate activities across the firm. Integrate and align efforts to share best practices and avoid re-inventing the wheel.', 'Act as a spokesperson internally across the firm to articulate actions, progress, metrics, goals and specific positive achievements.', 'Act as a spokesperson externally to speak about Gensler’s strategies, goals, specific actions and strong stance against racism.', 'Work with the Gensler Board of Directors as an advisor to the Anti-Racism Committee.', 'Work with the Organization and Talent Development leaders to support training and developing knowledge and capabilities to support a diverse community and culture. Develop and roll-out cultural change management to ignite greater diversity.', 'Work with the Research Institute to support the Center for Research on Equity and the Built Environment.', 'Work with the Legal team to assess and deal with issues of discrimination and racism.', 'Work with the HR leadership to monitor metrics and develop dashboards and critical analytics.', 'Work with HR to develop strategies to attract and retain diverse talent.', 'Develop blogs, articles and other POV materials to create the voice of our firm regarding DEI.', 'Minimum of 10-15 years of relevant experience with deep expertise in diversity initiatives and best practices', 'Education: Bachelor’s Degree in relevant topics including Business/HR, Sociology, Anthropology, Psychology, Urban Issues and Planning, Architecture, Government, International Studies', 'Excellent communication skills', 'Collaborative interpersonal skills', 'High emotional intelligence', 'Ability to influence and manage change']

['Conduct research and analysis about global forest trends, especially tropical deforestation, leveraging data available on GFW and other peer-reviewed research', 'Analyze geospatial data to discern deforestation trends and hotspots and generate statistics in response to requests from GFW users and team members', 'Conduct desk research to validate and tell stories around data trends as part of GFW’s Places to Watch project and other initiatives—e.g., interpreting recent satellite imagery, mining media stories, reaching out to local sources, and scanning peer-reviewed literature', 'Assist in the development of new methods and analyses to better leverage GFW’s data, particularly near-real-time deforestation alerts, based on user feedback', 'Produce technical documentation of analysis methods used and developed by GFW', 'Contribute to written outputs featuring GFW research and analysis, including peer-reviewed articles, WRI reports, and blog posts', 'Support project coordination with external research partners as needed, including scheduling meetings and assisting with research contracts', 'Provide support around forest change data sets for the Global Forest Watch platform', 'Evaluate new forest change data sets for quality, completeness, and relevance to the GFW mission', 'Advise the website team on how to display complex data and related metrics in an accurate and user-friendly way on the Global Forest Watch map and dashboards. Provide input on and help review designs and communication of analysis results', 'Write metadata and assist with obtaining permissions to add data sets to the website, as needed', 'Assist with data-specific queries from Global Forest Watch users, as needed', 'Develop deep technical expertise in the forest monitoring datasets featured on GFW—be able to speak to the methods, accuracy, utility, limitations, etc.', 'Answer technical questions about data from users via email and web conference', 'Present the GFW platform and data products to technical audiences', "Bachelor's degree in related field; minimum of 1 year of related professional work experience", 'Familiarity with GIS workflows and software; experience using GIS in a non-classroom setting', 'Experience working with large raster data sets, particularly satellite-based products', 'Strong writer and communicator; experience communicating to the general public around scientific data', 'Demonstrated ability to take initiative and complete open-ended tasks with minimal guidance', 'Experience working on issues related to tropical deforestation and/or forest monitoring', 'Prior experience contributing to scientific research', 'Basic programming skills (Python, Javascript, SQL, HTML) and/or experience with automating processes in systems like Google Earth Engine a plus', 'US work authorization is required for this role.']

opportunity must meet time-in-grade (TIG) requirement of 52 weeks of service at the next lower grade level in the normal line of progression for the position being filled.FOR THE GS-11 LEVEL: A performance plan is not an acceptable substitute.Current permanent FSA County employees must submit your most recent nonaward Notification of Personnel Action (SF-50) showing your highest grade (or promotion potential) held on a permanent basis, position title, series and grade AND most recent performance appraisal (dated within 18 months) per above.Veteran Hiring Authorities: VEOA, VRA and 30% Disabled Veterans: DD214, Certificate of Release from Active Duty that shows dates of service and discharge under honorable conditions. Submit performance rating(s) showing acceptable performance for each period counted towards eligibility signed by supervisor(s). If documentation does not exist for one or more periods, submit a statement from supervisor(s) indicating acceptable performance. job_title: Director of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
job_text: ['Work with Co-CEOs in managing and implementing Gensler’s “Strategies To Fight Racism.”', 'Provide Program Management oversight of broad initiatives and activities across the firm which are focused on growing the diverse communities within Gensler with particular focus on the Black community.', 'Work with the Global Race and Diversity Committee Co-Chairs to create alignment, track progress and effectiveness of the efforts.', 'Work with the RMPs and Regional diversity teams to coordinate activities across the firm. Integrate and align efforts to share best practices and avoid re-inventing the wheel.', 'Act as a spokesperson internally across the firm to articulate actions, progress, metrics, goals and specific positive achievements.', 'Act as a spokesperson externally to speak about Gensler’s strategies, goals, specific actions and strong stance against racism.', 'Work with the Gensler Board of Directors as an advisor to the Anti-Racism Committee.', 'Work with the Organization and Talent Development leaders to support training and developing knowledge and capabilities to support a diverse community and culture. Develop and roll-out cultural change management to ignite greater diversity.', 'Work with the Research Institute to support the Center for Research on Equity and the Built Environment.', 'Work with the Legal team to assess and deal with issues of discrimination and racism.', 'Work with the HR leadership to monitor metrics and develop dashboards and critical analytics.', 'Work with HR to develop strategies to attract and retain diverse talent.', 'Develop blogs, articles and other POV materials to create the voice of our firm regarding DEI.', 'Minimum of 10-15 years of relevant experience with deep expertise in diversity initiatives and best practices', 'Education: Bachelor’s Degree in relevant topics including Business/HR, Sociology, Anthropology, Psychology, Urban Issues and Planning, Architecture, Government, International Studies', 'Excellent communication skills', 'Collaborative interpersonal skills', 'High emotional intelligence', 'Ability to influence and manage change']

job_title: RN Work from Home New Hire Class September
job_text: ['Bring empathy and a passion for evidence-based care to all you do.', 'Multitasking and attention to detail are your superpowers.', 'You have a strong clinical background and believe part of your job as an RN is to advocate for your patients.', 'You roll with the punches on any given day, with any given interaction, and never lose sight of the need to use your stellar interpersonal and quick assessment skills.', 'You respect different cultures and know that rule-following is essential to your personal integrity and your employer’s quality compliance.', 'Work independently to make clinical decisions on routine patient care matters (at your license level)', 'Provide patient-focused care and guidance on the phone or online, including accurately assessing needs, delivering or directing to the appropriate level of care, identifying potential health problems and influencing people to make better health decisions', 'Communicate with our organization’s clients as needed and other team members, verbally and digitally', 'Monitor your own performance with dashboard metrics and look for ways to improve', 'Participate in coaching sessions to improve performance', 'Document all patient/member interactions via management software', 'A min of Three(3) years as a Registered Nurse with recent direct patient care experience; Five(5) years preferred in a high acuity level i.e. ICU, CC, ER, and or Tele - Health, Telephonic Triage.', 'Must currently reside and have an Multi - State unrestricted RN license in one of the following states: AR, CO, FL, GA, IA, LA, ME, MO, MS, NC, ND, NE, NM, OK, SC, SD, TN, TX, VA, WI', 'Ability to become licensed in additional states as required', "Minimum of an associate's degree from a two-year technical college or technical school, or diploma nursing program; Bachelor's degree preferred", 'Must provide college transcripts prior to employment', 'Full-time positions available', 'Your schedule will include at least four weekend days per month. Differential pay may be earned for certain shifts.', 'Training is 2-3 weeks, with the first two weeks being Monday-Friday. 100% Attendance is required. Training is done in a virtual, interactive classroom setting.', 'For work-from-home positions, your home office must meet certain certification requirements that would be explained to you during the interview process.', 'Being an integrity-driven organization that can truly change people’s lives', 'Serving others joyfully and individually—we’re driven by the power of personal connection', 'Pioneering next-generation healthcare consumer and clinical engagement experiences', 'An entrepreneurial mindset', 'A work/life balance']

['Orchestrate overall relationship with assigned clients, which will include: Growing adoption, ensuring retention, and happiness.', 'Work with clients to build Customer Success Plans, establishing critical goals, to aid the customer in achieving their objectives.', 'Measure and monitor customer’s achievement of critical and key performance indicators, reporting both internally to Splunk Account team and externally to Customer Sponsors and Executives.', 'Establish regular cadence (Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly) with each assigned client, to review executive dashboards, and program status.', 'Cement yourself as a trusted/strategic advisor with customers and drive continued value of our products and services.', 'Work closely with the Splunk Account Team (Account Manager, SE, PS and EDU) to find opportunities for new usage of Splunk across organizational functions.', 'Work to identify and/or develop upsell opportunities.', 'Advocate customer needs/issues cross-departmentally and program-manage customer concerns.', 'Assist and provide expert deployment, operational standard methodologies and establish a Splunk Center of Excellence.', 'Assist in workshops to help customers demonstrate the full value of Splunk solutions and lead periodic partner meetings.', 'Provide insight with respect to the availability and applicability of new products and features.', 'Support Professional Services with scoping, and selling follow-on and new service opportunities.', 'Support Education Services in identifying and recommending staff training opportunities.', 'Identify in cooperation with the Account team the key success criteria for Splunk deployment and drive customer happiness.', 'Act as the Splunk liaison for Splunk technical inquiries, issues or escalations. This will include working with Splunk Support, Product Management (i.e. roadmaps), or others as needed.', 'Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of the Splunk platform and future products.', '10 + years in a related function with direct customer advocacy and engagement experience in post-sales or professional services functions in Fortune 1000, mid-tier, start-up companies, or Public Sector organizations.', 'Prior experience working with State, Local and Education customers', "Since this role is essential to Splunk's customer success initiative, you will have a rich history of growing customer happiness, adoption, and retention.", 'Confirmed ability to drive continuous product value.', 'Experience developing product use-cases with customers.', 'You will be a strong teammate, but still a self-starter.', 'Since this role is customer facing, you will possess exceptional verbal, written, social, presentation, and interpersonal skills.', 'Thrives in a multi-tasking environment and can adjust priorities on-the-fly while still having the ability to focus on details and be analytical.', 'Good technical and problem solving skills coupled with the ability to provide quick resolution to problems.', 'Prior experience conducting workshops to customers and discussing pros cons of implementing various technologies and business value.', 'You have played in the Enterprise and/or cloud software space.', 'Experience navigating and steering customer engagements to completion with a high level of customer happiness.', 'Estimated travel is 25%. Since travel is based on customer and business need there may be more or less travel depending on location of customers.', 'Must be a U.S. Citizen']

He/She will present a reporting dashboard each week with tasks status information and shall record and report to the COR any risks which might impede directed tasks.', 'Shall take any/all steps necessary to resolve project/program performance issues that are within scope of this contract and within budget constraints.', 'On a weekly basis,shall provide the COR with separate written weekly Project Status Dashboard Reports that monitor the progress, cost, schedule, and labor hours expended to date for each Task Assignment under this SOW.', 'The Reports shall also include a list of all open issues and recommended solutions, risks and constraints that have emerged, and plans for the next reporting period.', 'Each report shall be submitted to the COR in accordance with the delivery schedule. job_title: Graduate Studies Program - Human Resources Analyst
job_text: ['Enrolled in a graduate program of study as a full time student in one of the following fields:', 'GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4-point scale, but exceptions may be made for extenuating circumstances', 'Ability to work at least one 90-day tour prior to graduation', 'Strong analytic and problem-solving skills', 'Exceptional customer service skills', 'Excellent interpersonal skills', 'Excellent organizational and time management skills', 'Strong initiative', 'Attention to detail', 'Comfortable working both independently and on teams', 'A thorough medical and psychological exam', 'A polygraph interview', 'A comprehensive background investigation']

['Short-term and medium-term outlook for U.S. economy', 'Developments in the U.S. financial sector (e.g., cost of and access to credit among consumers and small businesses; consumer and business financial stress; evolution of financial sector and rise of fintech)', 'Federal regulatory policy', 'U.S. fiscal and monetary policy', 'International public policy developments as they pertain to the U.S. economy (e.g., health of G20 economies and emerging markets, status of trade policy)', 'Other policy topics with a nexus to U.S. economic performance', 'Maintain a solid and expanding knowledge base around macroeconomic developments in general and policy issues relevant to client projects in particular.', 'Actively participate in team brainstorming sessions to identify clients’ analytical and strategic needs and ways to address them.', 'Conduct economic, data, and public policy analysis. Tasks include (but are not limited to) identifying data requirements, designing analytical approaches, and applying a creative mix of qualitative and quantitative methods to address client needs.', 'Translate complex analytical results into clear and compelling insights that have a clear nexus to client interests and needs.', 'Develop presentations and written reports for technical and non-technical audiences, utilizing charts, dashboards, infographics, and other forms of data visualization to communicate clearly, concisely, and comprehensively.', 'Assist with formulating project work plans with realistic timelines, budgets, and resource allocations.', 'Execute project work plans, including coordinating internal work efforts, ensuring that deadlines and objectives are met within an established budget constraint, and assisting project leaders with preparing progress reports.', 'Provide oversight to more junior staff, including delegating tasks, providing feedback, and instructing on analytical frameworks and methods.', 'Advanced degree in economics, public policy, business, or related field with at least two years of work experience in an economic research, public policy analysis or consulting field; or a relevant undergraduate degree and at least three to five years of experience in an economic research, public policy analysis, or consulting field.', 'Passion for public policy and the application of economic tools to policy challenges.', 'Demonstrated quantitative skills, including knowledge and application of economic principles and concepts, statistics, data analytics, and econometrics.', 'Strong written and oral communication skills, including experience with effectively communicating to both technical and non-technical audiences.', 'Strong project management skills, including experience translating general requests into clear goals and objectives. Experience building work plans, budgets, and schedules is a plus.', 'Strong organizational skills and a meticulous attention to detail, with a proven track record of producing high-quality, client-ready work within established timing and budget constraints.', 'Demonstrated client management skills — including experience communicating directly with clients through formal and informal channels (e.g., calls, emails, meetings, presentations). Experience as a project lead is a plus.', 'Ability to operate collaboratively within a team environment while also moving work forward independently as needed. Prior supervisory experience is a plus.', 'Proven ability to multitask in a professional service environment that often requires last minute adjustments to team and client priorities.', 'Naturally curious personality with a drive to understand how the world works and a demonstrated ability to quickly learn new topics or methods as needed.', 'Collegial “team-first” attitude, positive outlook, and a good sense of humor.']

['Create and edit webpages using the WordPress content management system (CMS).', 'Monitor Google Analytics dashboards tracking website visits and transactions.', 'Arrange Zoom webinars and serve as a co-moderator for livestream events.', 'Support the setup of ULI’s Events app for major annual events.', 'Serve colleagues across the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific as a WordPress, Google Analytics, and Zoom Webinar administrator, trainer, troubleshooter, and power user.', 'Act as primary responder to ULI’s internal help desk system for logging bugs, requesting training, and seeking assistance.', 'Partner with member-facing customer service colleagues to identify and resolve website issues that affect ULI members.', 'Partner with ULI staff and vendors to plan and test changes to ULI digital technology.', 'Write weekly summaries of help desk tickets and Zoom Webinar support.', 'Audit ULI’s 100-plus websites for errors, page-load times, plugin and CMS updates, and brand adherence.', 'Associate’s degree or bachelor’s degree preferred.', 'One to two years of professional experience.', 'Experience training or teaching others.', 'Experience working in a customer service environment', 'Strong self-starter with the ability to work independently as the role will be remote based initially', 'Strong time management skills required.', 'Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills required.', 'Strong written and oral communications skills required.', 'Experience editing and page building with a content management system required.', 'Experience with Microsoft Office software required.', 'Experience with teleconferencing software; Zoom preferred.', 'Experience with WordPress preferred.', 'Experience with HTML preferred.']

['Develop communication strategies, communication materials, social marketing concepts and collateral, and conduct outreach to effectively support the Directorate’s programs and Army Senior Leader priorities, goals, and objectives.', 'Establish and maintain an effective quality control program to ensure services are performed in accordance with task order requirements.', 'Provide support for development and execution of communication, social marketing, awareness, and outreach activities to include refinement of communication strategy, development of materials, implementation plans, and scheduling and coordination of outreach activities.', 'Generate and submit a monthly Status Report (SR) through the Human Resources Solutions portal NLT the 15th calendar day of each month. The SR shall include activities of those assigned to the project, problems encountered, actual or recommended corrective action, results from quality control inspections conducted by the contractor, and workload performed during the previous month.', 'Develop and deliver to the COR-RA an updated Strategic Communication Plan to include an SMR for Army SHARP programs and services and Army SHARP, Ready & Resilient Directorate’s programs and services, including Suicide Prevention, Personal Readiness & Resilience, and Alcohol & Substance Abuse, within 30 calendar days of the start of the TO. Use the best business practices in the marketing industry and include the following phases: a) Planning (i.e., SWOT analysis, marketing product focus and goal setting, marketing concept plan); b) Implementation (i.e., market segments, market positioning, perceptual maps, actions to reach target markets; and c) Evaluation (measurement against identified target markets, marketing dashboard, marketing grids). All products developed under this TO shall align to the Strategic Communication Plan and SMR. The SMR shall include media richness and self-disclosure analysis and a brand sustainability map. The government estimates approximately 40% of the Strategic Communication Plan will cover Army SHARP programs and 60% will cover Army SHARP, Ready & Resilient Directorate’s programs (Non SHARP).', "Produce a newsletter that is a minimum of 8 pages and a maximum of 12 pages (the front and back equals two pages) in length on a bi-monthly basis NLT the 20th of the 2nd month after start of the task order. The newsletter shall be based on Directorate priorities, the Quarterly Synch Schedule, articles provided in the weekly media updates for SHARP, and Ready & Resilient Directorate programs. The government estimates approximately 50% of newsletter articles are related to SHARP programs and 50% are related to Ready & Resilient Directorate's programs (Non SHARP).", 'Provide a products on demand site to store, assemble and distribute communication and marketing materials. The government estimates approximately 50% of marketing materials are related to SHARP programs and 50% are related to Ready & Resilient Directorate’s programs (Non SHARP). Accept receipt of deliveries from the Government Printing Office (GPO) and take to the appropriate storage location in accordance with the specifications of this TO prior to distributing. Add the marketing materials to the GFP inventory list. Ensure the storage of all SHARP marketing and exhibit materials is in a facility within a 50-mile radius of the SHARP & Resiliency Directorate’s headquarters located in Arlington, VA. Provide monthly inventory via an Excel spreadsheet of the quantity and status of marketing materials ordered/distributed by command and location to the COR-RA.', 'Coordinate with the COR-RA NLT within five work days after the post-award conference to initiate the process of accounting for all GFP needed to support contractor employees and TO requirements. Post copies of all inventory documentation to the HR Solutions portal and submit to the COR-RA within 10 calendar days after receipt of GFP or initial inventory.', 'Dispose/recycle old communication and marketing materials with the COR-RA’s written approval. Send a written request for approval to the COR-RA upon discovery of materials which are no longer requested/used.', 'Perform one assessment (e.g. focus groups, interviews, surveys, or combination thereof) every year to assess the effectiveness of messaging in SHARP and Ready & Resilient Directorate marketing materials and other communication products/platforms. This assessment is in addition to assessments completed in support of the development of new collateral for audiences. Coordinate the assessment with input from the SHARP, Ready & Resilient Directorate Communication, Outreach & Leadership Engagement Branch. Logistical arrangements (location and personnel for focus groups) shall be made by CTRMG with a letter of introduction provided by the government if the assessment is conducted on a government facility.', 'Conduct pretesting utilizing an online/web- based survey/focus group to ensure the ability to reach a variety of demographics for each targeted audience in each ACOM, ASCC, and DRU. Telephone interviews will be utilized for follow-up/in-depth interviews based on the results of the initial survey/focus groups.', 'Manage Government-approved, nationally recognized SMEs who can participate in conferences, provide recommendations on messaging, and other input to the Government. Submit a two-page report with recommendations to the Government for improvement to SHARP & Ready & Resiliency Directorate programs, services, messaging, etc. to the COR-RA within 10 work days after an event; and,', 'Execute one photo shoot each year to refresh images for SHARP & Resiliency Directorate marketing materials and other products. Stock photography/images are not permitted. It is anticipated the photo shoot will be held at Fort Bragg, NC. The actual location may vary depending on the needs of the Government. The photo shoot is typically 3-5 days in duration.', 'Minimum of 15 years’ experience in project management, a minimum of 5 years’ experience supporting social marketing programs, a minimum of 5 years’ experience supporting government programs.', 'Minimum of a master’s degree. In lieu of a master’s degree, 10 years’ experience supporting government programs.', 'Must be able to successfully pass the customer and government security process', 'This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required by this position.']

Federal Information Technology Acquisition Reform Act (FITARA); Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA); Technology Business Management (TBM); Acquisition life cycle management; and all related Clinger-Cohen Act, Chief Information Officer, and OMB information technology and investment policies and guidance.', 'Strong presentation, team building, and negotiation skills', 'Impeccable multi-tasking abilities and ability to support competing deadlines', 'Works well in a team and multi-vendor environment.', 'Ability to learn quickly, analyze data, and make recommendations for improvement.', 'Enthusiastic and proactive problem solver']

['5+ years of experience with human resources', 'Experience with projects spanning a broad array of human resource and human capital functional areas, including strategy, onboarding, learning, and development policy', 'Experience in Military manpower planning and human capital management', 'Knowledge of advanced workforce and talent planning processes and data analysis techniques', 'Ability to use advanced functionality in Microsoft Office, including Excel and MS Teams', 'Ability to perform qualitative and quantitative analysis, synthesis findings, and data visualization creation', 'Ability to obtain a security clearance', 'BA or BS degree', 'Experience with the application of Agile HR operational concepts', 'Experience with data visualization tools, including Tableau to communicate quantitative HR data insights', 'Experience with developing dashboards, scorecards, and reports that effectively depict complex and data-driven information in a concise and meaningful manner', 'Experience with collecting and reporting data from disparate HR data systems and reporting meaningful trend analysis and other insights', 'Experience in providing short- and long-term talent forecasting, identifying areas of concern, and providing leadership with recommended actions for improvement', 'Experience with IT systems and data analysis', 'Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills', 'Senior Professional in Human Resources (SPHR), Human Capital Strategist (HCS), or similar certification']

['Conduct security assessments in accordance with current NIST and DHS guidance, as well as policies and procedures for all systems and applications. This includes all Major Applications (MA), General Support Systems (GSS) and/or any subsystems, minor applications or other information systems.', 'Provide the subject matter expertise to support the capability to assess up to eight (8) individual systems simultaneously per federal government schedule', "Provide the subject matter expertise and proficiency using tools for security assessments, including but not limited to Nessus, WebInspect, DB Protect, Fortify, Appscan, Information Assurance Compliance System (IACS), RSA Archer, Nipper, Burp Suite Pro, WebSphere, ActiveState Perl, Aquafold, SoapUI Pro, Ultraedit, SNSScan, SolarWinds Engineer's Toolset, Fortify and/or other as required", 'Develop and provide all documentation necessary for performing a Security Control Assessment', 'Be proficient at testing, analyzing and interpreting Security Assessment Results for all systems', 'Conduct Security Control Assessments for each system as part of the Security Authorization Process.', 'Skilled at reviewing Database scans such as dBProtect', 'Knowledge of databases and configurations to be able to identify false positives, items of lower importance, items that are a needed config, etc.', 'Ability to create complex queries and dashboard, configure alerting, etc. in Splunk. Must know what the most critical events are per DB, application layer, and must know the type of audit logs most systems create.', 'Must have experience with Fortify or another static code analysis tool, particularly especially interpreting the results and recommending improvements.', 'Must have some programming/code experience, the ability to review code or code scans reports and determine false positives, correct severity ratings based on function of the systems, exposure and mitigations.', 'Must know Burp Suite Pro, or other static code tools.', 'Must have the ability to do Dynamic code scan review and manual testing using WebInspect. Knowledge of interfaces is key.', 'API and Microservice knowledge.', 'Cloud architecture knowledge (AWS experience is a must).', 'Knowledge of container platforms.', 'Ability to read and interpret Twistlock scans.', 'Ability to read and analyze Nessus. Tenable.io (TIO) experience is ideal, with the ability to read reports, interpret results and determine where any checks may have failed or were configured too stringently, or where the configuration would impact system functionality to recommend improvements.', 'At least three (3) years of specialized experience in one of the below positions: Information Systems Security Officer, Information Systems Security Engineer, Information Systems Security Auditor or Information Systems Security Manager.', 'A minimum of three (3) years of experience with analyzing, assessing and implementing corrective actions based on vulnerability management tools.', 'A minimum of three (3) years of experience with leading projects, technical writing, administrative tasks, and conducting briefings.', 'Must be a US Citizen able to obtain an agency-specific EOD clearance (required before starting) as well as the ability to obtain a DoD Top Secret Clearance.', 'Must have at least one (1) of the following certification: Security+, CASP, GSEC, GSLC, CISSP, CEH, CISM or CISA']

collaborate with community staff to provide research-based analysis to assist with cultivation/solicitation strategies; assist in identifying potential new prospects for key initiatives.', 'Synthesize research into organized engagement strategies to inform the appropriate outreach and communication approach and help prepare fundraisers to effectively engage with current and prospective donor partners.', 'Innovate and identify new research techniques, strategies, and sources.', 'Collaborate with different departments and colleagues to devise database enhancements, process improvements, and enhanced techniques.', 'Bachelor’s degree and 3+ years of advancement research, development, fundraising, and/or market research experience.', 'Proven propensity for digging into databases and using research data to advise business partners on high impact growth strategies.', 'Strong sense of curiosity and attention to detail.', 'An independent problem solver who can think proactively, take initiative, set priorities, and bring tasks to completion with appropriate follow-up, all within a complexly structured and evolving team.', 'High degree of professionalism, ethical sensitivity, confidentiality and discretion;
